attributes.action: Change DWP policies with repesct to the take any job rules
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned petition the prime minister to change DWP policies in respect of claimants who have suffered industrial injuries or illness to be allowed the option of full recovery on benefits in order to return to their original vocation. Claimants who specialise in one area of expertise and who are qualified only in these areas should not be penalised via the “do any job rules” that are currently in place. For elder statesmen and women especially there is no choice as they may have no qualifications or relevant experience in any other field than their own specialist area and the forcing of them out of one benefit into another and sometimes into a no benefit at all situation can create stress and hardship that is not conducive to speedy and or effective recovery.
In example: Work that is physically demanding, but also specialised wherein regaining the strength and flexibility of an injury is essential for that work to be carried out.
